text: All about farm animals. Today we will learn about the following animals. Cows, horses, pigs, sheep, chickens, goats. A baby cow is called a calf. Cows eat grass, alfalfa, clover, and hay. Fun fact, cows can smell things up to six miles away. A baby horse is called a foal. Horses eat grass, hay, corn, and oats. They also eat fruits and vegetables. Fun fact, horses sleep standing up. A baby pig is called a piglet. Wild pigs will eat leaves, roots, fruit, and rodents. Fun fact, pigs can't sweat. A baby sheep is called as lamb. Sheep eat mostly grass, plants, and seeds. Fun fact, sheep have rectangular pupils. A baby chicken is called a chick. Chickens eat grass, bugs, fruit, vegetables, and even table scraps. Fun fact, chickens dream when they sleep. A baby goat is called a kid. Goats eat shrubs, trees, hay, and grains. Fun fact, goats do not have front teeth in their upper jaw. Thanks for watching the video. Please subscribe and support us.

segments.text: All about farm animals. Today we will learn about the following animals.
Cows, horses, pigs, sheep, chickens, goats.
A baby cow is called a calf.
Cows eat grass, alfalfa, clover, and hay.
Fun fact, cows can smell things up to six miles away.
A baby horse is called a foal.
Horses eat grass, hay, corn, and oats.
They also eat fruits and vegetables.
Fun fact, horses sleep standing up.
A baby pig is called a piglet.
Wild pigs will eat leaves, roots, fruit, and rodents.
Fun fact, pigs can't sweat.
A baby sheep is called as lamb.
Sheep eat mostly grass, plants, and seeds.
Fun fact, sheep have rectangular pupils.
A baby chicken is called a chick.
Chickens eat grass, bugs, fruit, vegetables, and even table scraps.
Fun fact, chickens dream when they sleep.
A baby goat is called a kid.
Goats eat shrubs, trees, hay, and grains.
Fun fact, goats do not have front teeth in their upper jaw.
Thanks for watching the video. Please subscribe and support us.
